Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery open vessel, probably a bowl; white slip; interior: at rim black band; below, frieze of rays between bands; on top of rim, wide diagonal lines; exterior: black band below rim; below, frieze of triangles filled with diagonal line, the right edges in fuller, darker paint; below, low frieze of verticals between bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.113)
